text: The Salt Lake Organizing Committee for the Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games of 2002 (SLOC)Salt Lake City: Two Years To Go, The Paralympian 2/2000Website Privacy Policy , Official website of the 2002 Winter Paralympics was the organization responsible for the 2002 Winter Olympics and 2002 Winter Paralympics in Salt Lake City, USA. Paralympic Winter Games -- Salt Lake 2002 , The Official Website of the Beijing 2008 Olympic Games The SLOC secured their bid for the 2002 Olympic Games in 1995. After the SLOC was exposed to be in disarray in the ensuing years, Mitt Romney was hired in 1999 to turn around the failing organization. Under Romney's leadership, the SLOC ended up hosting a successful Olympic games with financial surpluses. Does Romney deserve Olympic bragging rights?, Washington Post, 3 Nov 2011 In June 2001, the International Olympic Committee (IOC) and the International Paralympic Committee (IPC) had signed an agreement that would ensure that the staging of the Paralympic Games is automatically included in the bid for the Olympic Games. The agreement came into effect at the 2008 Paralympic Summer Games in Beijing, and the 2010 Paralympic Winter Games in Vancouver. However, the Salt Lake 2002 Organizing Committee, chose to follow the practice of "one bid, one city" already at the 2002 Games in Salt Lake City, and hosted both the Olympics and the Paralympics.IPC-IOC Co-operation, The official website of the International Paralympic Committee == See also == *2002 Winter Olympic bid scandal ==References== Category:2002 Winter Paralympics Category:2002 Winter Olympics Category:Organising Committees for the Olympic Games Category:Organising Committees for the Paralympic Games Category:Sports in Salt Lake City
